titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Anti-Vivisection Activities
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Anti-Vivisection Activities FA142

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-03-14 00:17:28 -0400.

change.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvists’ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Anti-Vivisection Activities

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: correspondence, clippings, and printed material.

did.unittitle: Note on meeting of New York Academy of Medicine Antivivisection Committee

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Exchange with following (includes copies of correspondence with others) John J. Abel, George Baehr, W.B. Cannon, A.J. Carlson, Rufus Cole, E.H.L. Corwin, E.C. Cutler, Joseph Erlanger, Simon Flexner, H.T. Karsner, V. Kellog, G.M. Kober, B.E. Livingston, E.P. Lyon, Wm. Welch. Includes handwritten letters' by Welsh and Rous., G. Whipple, J.L. Whitely, H. Williams, M.C. Winternitz.

Copies of letters sent to members of Committee on Codes in the New York Assembly expressing opposition to Vaughn Bill

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes: Letters sent by Chairman of Committee on Medical Research requesting expressions of opposition to the Vaughn Bill. Letters from members of Committee on Medical Research and Officers of other Committees of Medical Society of the State of New York. Letters from Presidents and Secretaries of County Medical Societies. Letters from Officers of Institutions and Members of the Faculties of Medical Schools in New York State. Letters from Health Officers. Letters sent by Members of New York State Association of Public Health Laboratories. Letters from Lawyers. Miscellaneous letters from Rochester Chamber of Commerce and from individuals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes notes by Simon Flexner. Affidavits by: Tessie Butler, Alexis Carrel, Emil Clausnitzer, Tom Horton, P.A. Levene, Katharine Lilly, S.J. Meltzer. Includes handwritten copy by Meltzer., Eugene L. Opie, Max Sloman,
Partial affidavit, page 1 and 2 lacking, by RIMR scientific staff re Mrs. Kennedy's affidavit.
Note in front of partial affidavit "VIVISECTION Original affidavits of certain members of the staff of The Rockefeller Institute were taken by Mr. Jerome D. Greene March 2, 1912. Initialed "M.L.N"

did.unittitle: Newspaper clippings re RIMR and anti-vivisectionists. Includes photocopies. re RIMR, handwritten notes and comments w/ Mrs. Kennedy's and Mr. Dutton's affidavits and Mr. Smith's deposition
Defense of Research Pamphlets 1-27 (AMA) and New York Medical Society Animal Experimentation Pamphlets re animal research

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Appears to be maintained for Peyton Rous. Table of contents in front of each folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [See also: Box 12, folders 4,5,6].

did.unittitle: New York Medical Society Animal Experimentation Pamphlets

did.physdesc: In 1 - 5" letter and 1 - 21/2" letter size boxes. GL 9/86

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence primarily with Peyton Rous; some with Simon Flexner and Herbert S. Gasser re defense of animal experimentation and medical research and its legislation for and against. Indications are that these files maintained by Dr. Peyton F. Rous as a representative of the Rockefeller Institute (RI) from 1929 on, speaking before the Codes Committee of the New York State Assembly.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order by correspondent.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original document is Closed. Researchers should access the photocopy available in Box 22.

did.unittitle: New York Supreme Court. Harry Moran against David H. Shelling

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photostatic copy of testimony and Record of Appeal in 1927. Complaint by Harry Moran, an agent for the Humane Society of New York against David H. Shelling re torturing a dog.
